solution.text:
given that product of the roots is greater than zeros and sum of the roots is lesser than zero
\(\Rightarrow \alpha +\beta\lt\)0 and \(\alpha\times \beta\gt\)0
If \(\alpha\times \beta\gt\)0 \(\Rightarrow \)both the roots are negative and or both are positive because either \((+) \times (+) = (+)\) or \((-) \times (-) = (-)\)
\(\Rightarrow \) graph number 3 is not at all suitable
Now \(\alpha +\beta\lt\)0, \(\Rightarrow \) so at least one the zeros is negative
Combining the 2 conditions obtained we can say that both the zeros are negative.
\(\Rightarrow \) the curve will cut the negative x-axis twice
Hence the number 2 and 4 graph are suitable

content.text:
\(\alpha \) and \(\beta \) are the zeros of a quadratic equation whose product of the zeros is greater than 0 but sum of the zeros is lesser than 0.
From the given graphs choose the one(s) which are suitable to satisfy the above condition.
